On a dark winter night, wealthy and enigmatic Mr. John Q. Boddy hosted a small, but lavish, dinner party for some of his closest associates. However, the night ended in tragedy when Mr. Boddy was found dead in one of the rooms of Tudor Mansion in the early hours of the morning. The following persons of interest have been identified as suspects:

• Mrs. Peacock
• Madame Rose
• Miss Peach
• Mrs. White

And the following weapons were found on the premises:

• Poison
• Horseshoe
• Lead Pipe

The murder could only have occured in one of the following rooms:

1. Carriage House
2. Gazebo
3. Library
4. Hall
5. Drawing Room
6. Cloak Room

The rooms are laid out as follows:

  N N  
W 1|2 E
W 3|4 E
W 5|6 E
  S S  

The exact time of the murder is a bit uncertain, but it has been narrowed down to one of the following times:

• 10:30 PM
• 11:00 PM
• 11:30 PM
• 12:00 AM
• 12:30 AM

At every time the suspects and Mr. Boddy either stayed in their current room or moved to an orthogonally adjacent room (north, south, east, or west). Weapons could be moved by suspects between rooms as well.

Each suspect uniquely had one of the following possible motives for killing Mr. Boddy:

• Jealousy
• Anger
• Hatred
• Betrayal

For the murder to occur, the murderer and Mr. Boddy must have been alone in a room with at least one weapon at some point in the night. Any clue about Mr. Boddy's whereabouts should be read as "Mr. Boddy (dead or alive) ..."

The available clues are as follows:

- The murder weapon was in the same room as Mr. Boddy at 11:30 PM
- Miss Peach was in the room just north of Mrs. Peacock at 11:00 PM
- Madame Rose moved from the Drawing Room to the Library at 11:00 PM
- Miss Peach was in the room just south of the Poison at 10:30 PM
- The suspect motivated by Anger moved the Lead Pipe from the Drawing Room to the Library at 12:30 AM
- Madame Rose and Mrs. White were in the Hall together at least once
- The murder weapon was in the Hall at 12:30 AM or the Poison was in the Carriage House at 12:00 AM
- The suspect motivated by Hatred was in the Hall at 10:30 PM
- Mrs. White was in the room just east of the Horseshoe at 12:30 AM
- The suspect motivated by Hatred moved from the Hall to the Library at 11:30 PM
- The Horseshoe was in the same room as Miss Peach at 12:00 AM
- The murder weapon was in the Carriage House at 10:30 PM or Mrs. Peacock was in the Cloak Room at 10:30 PM
- The Horseshoe was in the Hall at 10:30 PM
- The murderer was in the Library at 11:30 PM
- The suspect motivated by Jealousy was in the Library at 12:30 AM
- The suspect motivated by Jealousy moved the Horseshoe from the Hall to the Library at 11:30 PM
- Mrs. Peacock was in the room just east of Mr. Boddy at 11:30 PM
- Mrs. White was in the room just east of Madame Rose at 12:00 AM
- The Horseshoe was in the Library at 12:00 AM if and only if the murder weapon was in the Drawing Room at 11:30 PM

Please answer the following question(s):

A. Who murdered Mr. Boddy?
B. What weapon did the murderer use?
C. Where was the murder committed?
D. When did the murder occur?
E. Why did the murderer do it?

And the following bonus question(s):

F. Where was the Lead Pipe at 12:00 AM?
G. Where was the Poison at 12:00 AM?

Fill out your final answers in the following format:

A. SUSPECT
B. WEAPON
C. ROOM
D. TIME

G. ROOM

8. Study

W 7|8|9 E
  S S S

• Power

• Hatred
• Greed
• Betrayal
• Jealousy

For the murder to occur, the murderer and Mr. Boddy must have been alone in a room with at least one weapon.

However, the night ended in tragedy when Mr. Boddy was found dead in one of the rooms of Tudor Mansion in the early hours of the morning.
